intro: Cyrtandra × austrohiloensis, commonly known as the hybrid Cyrtandra, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to Hawaii, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. It has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra × austrohiloensis is notable for its role in Hawaiian ecosystems and its potential use in horticulture.
